name: All the Colors of the Dark

title: Amazing
content: I loved this book so much.  It got a little long at points but the story is so good you don't mind.  Absolutely beautifully told. So sad at times you cry but then there is hope. Well done Mr. Whitaker.

title: Verified Purchase

post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2024

title: A Heartbreakingly Timeless Masterpiece
content: This story will forever hold a place in my imagination and its characters dear to my heart! This story brings you deep into the depths of characters you‚Äôll end up feeling like you know personally. It starts out with a tragic unfolding of the monstrous side of humanity, brings you through a decades-long search for truth and justice, ultimately putting integral pieces of a much larger puzzle together for the reader in a way that leaves you breathless and tugging on your heartstrings.  The characters all develop over these decades as a result of what they cope with and hold onto, and the result is a timeless story that brings you to question - What truly makes a person? If you‚Äôre a reader who‚Äôs in it for the long haul for a story that unfolds in great details of life and the enormity of it‚Ä¶ if stories like Stephen King‚Äôs The Green Mile and Delia Owen‚Äôs Where The Crawdads Sing open your heart and mind to essence of human imperfection simultaneously existing with the desire for redemption and justice‚Ä¶you MUST read this book!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2024

title: wow. just such beautiful writing

The story became a little convoluted for me at times with all the different girls but it needed to be that way, I understand. The author does a great job of tying it all together, though. I just had trouble remembering some of the girls and theirfull names, which becomes important, especially at the end. I would definitely recommend this book to friends who are mystery thriller fans.

title: Mysterious, heartwarming and sad
content: I‚Äôm a bit of a snob when it comes to books. I download many samples, and of those, I usually purchase one, maybe two. Chris Whitiker‚Äôs book is one of the best I‚Äôve ever read. The book is long but taut and absent of cliches and over-describing/explaining. It's darkly beautiful. I greatly appreciated his distinctive (often idiosyncratic) writing style. It had me in awe and a bit envious of his ability to manipulate language in a way that consistently surprised and delighted me, so refreshing from the usual fare. I‚Äôve already downloaded another of his books. I highly recommend this talented author!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: When I finished this book as I had tears streaming down my face, I told my husband ‚Äúthis book is life-changing ‚Äúand while  that might sound dramatic, that‚Äôs how I felt at the time. title: Worth more than 5 stars!
content: All the Colors of the Dark by Chris Whitaker is easily the best book I‚Äôve read all year.  It is a book about endless love, tragedy, and hope; both a coming of age novel as well as a years-long mystery. Chris Whitaker‚Äôs writing is like music, with one note leading to the next, pulling the reader along with crescendos and interludes as he skillfully reveals the decades-long relationship between Patch and Saint with all its complexities. The last 30 or so pages are so beautiful, it was almost unbearable.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2024
